availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Howard Todd (Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff.)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Willina B. Duvall Todd in Scott County, Kentucky, on January 10, 1838. Father of Lewis Todd, Annette Todd, Jane B. Todd, William Pike Todd, Bettie Todd, Howard Todd Jr., James Gayle Todd, Mattie Todd, and G. W. Murray Todd. Farmer in Owen County, Kentucky, in 1860. Sheriff in Owen County in 1862. Owned eight enslaved persons in Owen County in 1850. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Owen County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 419.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 172.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 173A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film #000183225, p. 17 (of microfilm), (accessed via ancestry.com).
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 195.
